title: Biden Picks Female Admiral to Lead Navy. She’d Be the First Woman Military Service Chief
description: If confirmed, Lisa Franchetti would be the first woman to be a U.S. military service chief.

description: What to know about how the true story of Oppenheimer's life compares to writer-director Christopher Nolan's new movie.

title: UPS Is Failing Part-Time Workers Like Me
description: "Part-time employees work extremely hard to make this company its profits, and we deserve to share in that success," writes Cesar Castro.

title: Praise Petey Is Summer TV’s Most Delightful Surprise

title: The Data Don’t Really Support the Most Popular Happiness Strategies

title: Barbie Is a Movie About Male Fragility. Let’s Dig In
description: Along with Don't Worry Darling and Promising Young Woman, Barbie asks what to do with the modern man who feels emasculated by women's power.

title: The Last Time Our Planet Was This Hot, Woolly Mammoths Roamed the Earth
description: The Eemian period is Earth’s past and portent—a potential warning of the kind of climate upheaval we face if global temperatures rise by 2ºC.

title: The Navajo Suffered From Nuclear Testing. Oppenheimer Doesn’t Tell Our Story

description: Greta Gerwig drew inspiration from unlikely sources such as Grease, Top Gun, and Sylvester Stallone when dreaming up the film.

title: Trial Date Set for May 2024 in Trump’s Classified Documents Case
description: The date is a compromise between a request from prosecutors to set the trial for this December and a request from defense lawyers to schedule it after the 2024 presidential election.

title: Pioneering Hacker Kevin Mitnick, FBI-Wanted Felon Turned Security Guru, Dead at 59

title: Hong Kong Government Makes Case in Court for Banning Protest Anthem
description: Government prosecutors argued the tune’s proliferation online was a matter of national security that would plant seeds of secession.

title: South Korea’s Infanticide Problem Highlights Wider Population Struggles
description: Recent killings shocked the nation and spurred tougher punishments for murdering or abandoning babies—but experts worry about unaddressed root causes.
